description: Council members clash after the citywide broadcast. Quietly, pressure grows within the chamber for a response that addresses public outrage head-on.
Using his clearance, the former Executive Assistant releases sealed Council documents and confirms support for public hearings. News quietly spreads that files will be opened for tribunal review.
Restoration tribunals open in major squares, live-streamed for all. Erased citizens recount their experiences of wrongful exclusion and systemic erasure.
Public protests are paused as hope grows for fair redress. Influential BCI administrators publicly admit to manipulating scores, offering carefully prepared apologies.
Internal Council debates grow heated. Some argue the tribunals are performative, while others push for deeper reforms. The Directorate calls the process a distraction from true order.
Select cases yield public pardons and score restoration. Observers note that many confessions and reconciliations seem rehearsed, fueling suspicion of political theater.
Citywide calm returns, but rumors spread about back-room deals, hidden records, and the unresolved fate of many erased citizens. Tensions and distrust, though muted, persist.
